fields.name: protospacer
fields.description: sequence of protospacer

fields.name: targeting
fields.description: 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', depending on whether or not the guide is targeting a locus of the genome relevant to the experiment. If guide is safe-targeting or non-targeting, targeting = False. 'safe-targeting' refers to guides designed to target genomic sites with no annotated function, used as negative controls, if targeting == False, guide_chr, guide_start, guide_end, strand, and pam can be set to NaN

fields.name: type
fields.description: flexible tag describing the role of the guide in the experiment

fields.name: guide_chr
fields.description: chromosome of guide, ex. chrX, chr2, chr10

fields.name: guide_start
fields.description: base start position of guide

fields.name: guide_end
fields.description: base end position of guide

fields.name: strand
fields.description: Strand of guide, + or -. If strandedness is unclear or unnecessary, use 'NaN' for the strand

fields.name: pam
fields.description: protospacer adjacent motif

fields.name: primer_binding_sequence
fields.description: intended primer binding sequence in the pegRNA

fields.name: primer_binding_start
fields.description: base start position of primer binding sequence in genome

fields.name: primer_binding_end
fields.description: base end position of primer binding sequence in genome

fields.name: rt_template_sequence
fields.description: intended reverse transcriptase template sequence in the pegRNA

fields.name: peg_sequence
fields.description: intended reverse transcriptase template sequence in the pegRNA

fields.name: genomic_element
fields.description: type of the genomic element being targeted, ex. gene, enhancer, promoter, insulator

fields.name: intended_target_name
fields.description: name of target element, should use existing conventions whenever possible: SPDI_id, ensembl_id, HGNC_id. If intended_target_name == NaN, then the target element will be referenced using its coordinates

fields.name: intended_target_chr
fields.description: chromosome of target

fields.name: intended_target_start
fields.description: base start position of target. For CRISPRa, CRISPRi and CRISPR KO screens, coordinates should reference the targeted element. For base editing and prime editing screens, coordinates should reference the targeted edit

fields.name: intended_target_end
fields.description: base end position of target

fields.name: putative_target_genes
fields.description: list of relevant genes associated with target element

fields.name: reporter
fields.description: sequence of reporter element

fields.name: imperfect
fields.description: sequence of corresponding perfect guide RNA (pgRNA)
